content: On September 6, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced the San Diego Padres in a pivotal game that showcased the brilliance of pitcher Tom Glavine. Glavine threw a complete game, allowing just one run on five hits, leading the Braves to a 5-1 victory. This performance not only solidified Glavine's status as a top-tier pitcher but also helped propel the Braves toward their eventual NL pennant and a remarkable run that culminated in the World Series that year.
